content: How are things going for everyone with the COVID-19 pandemic spread in your local area?
I'm the second day in home office, and have a well stocked cellar ;)

In my area, nearly everyone has converted to remote teleworking indefinitely (like GSoC) so that's actually going to be really good in some respects for open source activity. Likely will be mandatory "shelter in place" by next week.
Ditto, I probably had two months of food before we locked down, went full-time home office on Monday indefinitely.
We were asked to do home office next day on Monday, but I needed an additional day for server back-ups etc..

self-isolating, work in office by exception and only on odd week numbers. short-term panic on supplies (food, toiletries) and services (health, social, waste etc). Next week will probably be worse for the virus, but maybe some of the aforementioned will stabalise
